clinical_study.brief_title: DAHANCA 33: Image Guided Dose-escalated Radiotherapy to Patients With Hypoxic HNSCC
clinical_study.official_title: DAHANCA 33: Functional Image Guided Dose-escalated Radiotherapy to Patients With Hypoxic Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck

lead_sponsor.agency: Danish Head and Neck Cancer Group

clinical_study.source: Danish Head and Neck Cancer Group

brief_summary.textblock: Aim: To improve curability of radiotherapy in HNSCC patients identified by hypoxic FAZA-PET scanning

detailed_description.textblock:
Prospective phase II study aiming to improve the outcome in hypoxic resistent patients identified by FAZA-PET.
Inclusion:
Patients must fulfill the following:
Positive hypoxic FAZA-PET Scanning (as described in DAHANCA 24 - see citation) Stage III-IV, Squamous cell carcinoma of the larynx, pharynx or oral cavity (HPVneg (oropharynx) Indication for hyperfractionated accelerated radiotherapy with concommitant cis-platin and nimorazole

primary_outcome.description: loco-regional failure defined as persistent or recurrent disease in tumor and/or regional lymphnode sites (within the radiotherapy treated volume). The primary endpoint did not include the effect of a successful procedure with salvage surgery (no primary neck dissection was allowed).

secondary_outcome.description: Disease-specific death is defined as death from or with the cancer in question;

clinical_study.condition: Locally Advanced Head and Neck Cancer

arm_group.description: HART-CN: Hyperfractionated accelerated radiotherapy with weekly concommitant cisplatin and nimorazole

intervention.description: HART-CN: Hyperfractionated accelerated radiotherapy with weekly concommitant cis-platin and daily nimorazole

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Stage III-IV larynx, pharynx, oral cavity
- Hypoxic FAZA-PET positive
- Indication for primary radio-chemotherapy
- Informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- HPV positive oropharynx cancer
- Primary surgery

facility.name: Department of Experimental Clinical Oncology, Aarhus University Hospital

FAZA PET/CT hypoxia imaging in patients with squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck treated with radiotherapy: results from the DAHANCA 24 trial.
